title: Set Theory Calculator – Interactive Set Operations & Definitions

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: \(\mathbb{N} = \{ n \in \mathbb{Z} : n \ge 0 \}\) “The set of integers n such that n is greater than or equal to 0.”

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: A \(\subseteq\) B means “A is a subset of B”. A = B if and only if A \(\subseteq\) B and B \(\subseteq\) A.

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: A \(\cup\) B = { x : x \(\in\) A or x \(\in\) B }

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: A \(\cap\) B = { x : x \(\in\) A and x \(\in\) B }

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: A \ B = { x : x \(\in\) A and x \(\notin\) B }
